name: 更多孔 More Sockets (extra sockets in all gear)
description: More sockets enabled in all gear pieces, unleash your crafting potential ;)
author: Shadedness

config.name: Gear level for increased number of sockets
config.description: Set the gear level affected for increased number of sockets (up to 6): Normal, Exceptional (Nightmare/lvl 25+), or Elite (Hell/lvl 40+). The number of sockets is still limited to the number of inventory squares taken up by the item.

config.name: Enable Sockets on Throwing Weapons?
config.description: Enable Throwing weapons to be socketed.

config.name: Increase Helms to 4 sockets?
config.description: NOT recommended - Increasing helms to 4 sockets will make it harder to find helms suitable for helm runewords as they are typically 2 or 3 sockets only.

config.name: Glove sockets act like
config.description: How should gems & runes treat glove sockets? This defines which effects from gems & runes are applied. RECOMMENDED: Weapon sockets since you're using hands & arms to attack, so it makes more sense.

config.name: How many sockets in Gloves?
config.description: This defines how many sockets should be available in gloves. 'Gear level dependant' will allow 2 sockets for Normal gear, 3 sockets for Exceptional / Nightmare gear, and 4 sockets for Elite / Hell gear. RECOMMENDED: Gear Level Dependant for a bit more balance.

config.name: Boot sockets act like
config.description: How should gems & runes treat boot sockets? This defines which effects from gems & runes are applied. RECOMMENDED: Armor sockets since boots don't usually act as weapons or shields.

config.name: How many sockets in Boots?
config.description: This defines how many sockets should be available in boots. 'Gear level dependant' will allow 2 sockets for Normal gear, 3 sockets for Exceptional / Nightmare gear, and 4 sockets for Elite / Hell gear. NOTE: Gear Level Dependant can have unexpected limitations for adding sockets to white items due to the way the game calculates item levels.

config.name: Belt sockets act like
config.description: How should gems & runes treat belt sockets? This defines which effects from gems & runes are applied. NOTE: Gear Level Dependant can have unexpected limitations for adding sockets to white items due to the way the game calculates item levels.

config.name: How many sockets in Belts?
config.description: This defines how many sockets should be available in belts. 'Gear level dependant' will allow 1 sockets for Normal gear, 2 sockets for Exceptional / Nightmare gear and above. NOTE: Gear Level Dependant can have unexpected limitations for adding sockets to white items due to the way the game calculates item levels.

config.name: Enable Sockets on Jewelry?
config.description: Enable Ring and Amulets to be socketed.

config.name: Jewelry sockets act like
config.description: How should gems & runes treat ring and amulet sockets? This defines which effects from gems & runes are applied. RECOMMENDED: Shields to bring some variety, and jewelry is often encompassing resistance bonuses like shields do.
